channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Towards Learning from Graphs with Heterophily: Progress and Future
item.description: Graphs are structured data that models complex relations between real-world entities.

item.title: Divide and not forget: Ensemble of selectively trained experts in Continual Learning
item.description: Class-incremental learning is becoming more popular as it helps models widen their applicability while not forgetting what they already know.

item.title: Adaptive Self-training Framework for Fine-grained Scene Graph Generation
item.description: To this end, we introduce a Self-Training framework for SGG (ST-SGG) that assigns pseudo-labels for unannotated triplets based on which the SGG models are trained.

item.title: Enhancing Image-Text Matching with Adaptive Feature Aggregation
item.description: Image-text matching aims to find matched cross-modal pairs accurately.

item.title: Enhanced Automated Quality Assessment Network for Interactive Building Segmentation in High-Resolution Remote Sensing Imagery
item.description: In this research, we introduce the enhanced automated quality assessment network (IBS-AQSNet), an innovative solution for assessing the quality of interactive building segmentation within high-resolution remote sensing imagery.

item.title: When Neural Code Completion Models Size up the Situation: Attaining Cheaper and Faster Completion through Dynamic Model Inference
item.description: These findings motivate our exploration of dynamic inference in code completion and inspire us to enhance it with a decision-making mechanism that stops the generation of incorrect code.

item.title: Sub2Full: split spectrum to boost OCT despeckling without clean data
item.description: Optical coherence tomography (OCT) suffers from speckle noise, causing the deterioration of image quality, especially in high-resolution modalities like visible light OCT (vis-OCT).

item.title: Comparative Study on the Performance of Categorical Variable Encoders in Classification and Regression Tasks
item.description: This study broadly classifies machine learning models into three categories: 1) ATI models that implicitly perform affine transformations on inputs, such as multi-layer perceptron neural network; 2) Tree-based models that are based on decision trees, such as random forest; and 3) the rest, such as kNN.

item.title: Explicitly Disentangled Representations in Object-Centric Learning
item.description: Extracting structured representations from raw visual data is an important and long-standing challenge in machine learning.

item.title: Counterfactual Reasoning with Probabilistic Graphical Models for Analyzing Socioecological Systems
item.description: Causal and counterfactual reasoning are emerging directions in data science that allow us to reason about hypothetical scenarios.

item.title: A Comparison Benchmark for Distributed Hybrid MPC Control Methods: Distributed Vehicle Platooning
item.description: We propose distributed control of a platoon of autonomous vehicles as a comparison benchmark problem.

item.title: PPNet: A Novel Neural Network Structure for End-to-End Near-Optimal Path Planning
item.description: The results show PPNet can find a near-optimal solution in 15. 3ms, which is much shorter than the state-of-the-art path planners.

item.title: Chem-FINESE: Validating Fine-Grained Few-shot Entity Extraction through Text Reconstruction
item.description: Fine-grained few-shot entity extraction in the chemical domain faces two unique challenges.

item.title: Predicting Viral Rumors and Vulnerable Users for Infodemic Surveillance
item.description: We propose a novel approach to predict viral rumors and vulnerable users using a unified graph neural network model.

item.title: EfficientRec an unlimited user-item scale recommendation system based on clustering and users interaction embedding profile
item.description: The businesses are constantly growing users and products, causing the number of users and items to continuously increase over time, to very large numbers.

item.title: GPAvatar: Generalizable and Precise Head Avatar from Image(s)
item.description: Head avatar reconstruction, crucial for applications in virtual reality, online meetings, gaming, and film industries, has garnered substantial attention within the computer vision community.

item.title: R-Judge: Benchmarking Safety Risk Awareness for LLM Agents
item.description: We introduce R-Judge, a benchmark crafted to evaluate the proficiency of LLMs in judging safety risks given agent interaction records.

item.title: Better Explain Transformers by Illuminating Important Information
item.description: Transformer-based models excel in various natural language processing (NLP) tasks, attracting countless efforts to explain their inner workings.

item.title: Model Compression Techniques in Biometrics Applications: A Survey
item.description: The development of deep learning algorithms has extensively empowered humanity's task automatization capacity.

item.title: Automatic Tuning of Denoising Algorithms Parameters Without Ground Truth
item.description: Denoising is omnipresent in image processing.

item.title: GA-SmaAt-GNet: Generative Adversarial Small Attention GNet for Extreme Precipitation Nowcasting
item.description: In light of this, we propose GA-SmaAt-GNet, a novel generative adversarial architecture that makes use of two methodologies aimed at enhancing the performance of deep learning models for extreme precipitation nowcasting.

item.title: RAP-SAM: Towards Real-Time All-Purpose Segment Anything
item.description: Segment Anything Model (SAM) is one remarkable model that can achieve generalized segmentation.

item.title: All in How You Ask for It: Simple Black-Box Method for Jailbreak Attacks
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) like ChatGPT face `jailbreak' challenges, where safeguards are bypassed to produce ethically harmful prompts.

item.title: Cooperative Edge Caching Based on Elastic Federated and Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning in Next-Generation Network
item.description: Finally, we propose a multi-agent deep reinforcement learning (MADRL) based algorithm to decide where the predicted popular contents are collaboratively cached among SBSs.

item.title: Question-Answer Cross Language Image Matching for Weakly Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Class Activation Map (CAM) has emerged as a popular tool for weakly supervised semantic segmentation (WSSS), allowing the localization of object regions in an image using only image-level labels.

item.title: The Manga Whisperer: Automatically Generating Transcriptions for Comics
item.description: In the past few decades, Japanese comics, commonly referred to as Manga, have transcended both cultural and linguistic boundaries to become a true worldwide sensation.

item.title: A Simple Latent Diffusion Approach for Panoptic Segmentation and Mask Inpainting
item.description: Panoptic and instance segmentation networks are often trained with specialized object detection modules, complex loss functions, and ad-hoc post-processing steps to handle the permutation-invariance of the instance masks.

item.title: Learning to Extract Distributed Polarization Sensing Data from Noisy Jones Matrices
item.description: We consider the problem of recovering spatially resolved polarization information from receiver Jones matrices.

item.title: Enabling Efficient Equivariant Operations in the Fourier Basis via Gaunt Tensor Products
item.description: We mathematically connect the commonly used Clebsch-Gordan coefficients to the Gaunt coefficients, which are integrals of products of three spherical harmonics.

item.title: SkyEyeGPT: Unifying Remote Sensing Vision-Language Tasks via Instruction Tuning with Large Language Model
item.description: Specifically, after projecting RS visual features to the language domain via an alignment layer, they are fed jointly with task-specific instructions into an LLM-based RS decoder to predict answers for RS open-ended tasks.

item.title: Meme-ingful Analysis: Enhanced Understanding of Cyberbullying in Memes Through Multimodal Explanations
item.description: A Contrastive Language-Image Pretraining (CLIP) projection-based multimodal shared-private multitask approach has been proposed for visual and textual explanation of a meme.

item.title: PatchAD: Patch-based MLP-Mixer for Time Series Anomaly Detection
item.description: In this study, we introduce PatchAD, a novel multi-scale patch-based MLP-Mixer architecture that leverages contrastive learning for representational extraction and anomaly detection.

item.title: VMamba: Visual State Space Model
item.description: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) and Vision Transformers (ViTs) stand as the two most popular foundation models for visual representation learning.

item.title: A Survey on Hardware Accelerators for Large Language Models
item.description: This paper presents a comprehensive survey on hardware accelerators designed to enhance the performance and energy efficiency of Large Language Models.

item.title: Code Prompting Elicits Conditional Reasoning Abilities in Text+Code LLMs
item.description: We propose a chain of prompts that transforms a natural language problem into code and prompts the LLM with the generated code.

item.title: Source Code Clone Detection Using Unsupervised Similarity Measures
item.description: Assessing similarity in source code has gained significant attention in recent years due to its importance in software engineering tasks such as clone detection and code search and recommendation.

item.title: Supervised Fine-tuning in turn Improves Visual Foundation Models
item.description: Image-text training like CLIP has dominated the pretraining of vision foundation models in recent years.

item.title: Instance Brownian Bridge as Texts for Open-vocabulary Video Instance Segmentation
item.description: To mold instance queries to follow Brownian bridge and accomplish alignment with class texts, we design Bridge-Text Alignment (BTA) to learn discriminative bridge-level representations of instances via contrastive objectives.

item.title: OMG-Seg: Is One Model Good Enough For All Segmentation?
item.description: In this work, we address various segmentation tasks, each traditionally tackled by distinct or partially unified models.

item.title: Deep spatial context: when attention-based models meet spatial regression
item.description: The DSCon allows for a quantitative measure of the spatial context's role using three Spatial Context Measures: $SCM_{features}$, $SCM_{targets}$, $SCM_{residuals}$ to distinguish whether the spatial context is observable within the features of neighboring regions, their target values (attention scores) or residuals, respectively.

item.title: MM-Interleaved: Interleaved Image-Text Generative Modeling via Multi-modal Feature Synchronizer
item.description: Developing generative models for interleaved image-text data has both research and practical value.

item.title: CPCL: Cross-Modal Prototypical Contrastive Learning for Weakly Supervised Text-based Person Re-Identification
item.description: Weakly supervised text-based person re-identification (TPRe-ID) seeks to retrieve images of a target person using textual descriptions, without relying on identity annotations and is more challenging and practical.

item.title: Rigid Protein-Protein Docking via Equivariant Elliptic-Paraboloid Interface Prediction
item.description: The study of rigid protein-protein docking plays an essential role in a variety of tasks such as drug design and protein engineering.

item.title: Remote Sensing ChatGPT: Solving Remote Sensing Tasks with ChatGPT and Visual Models
item.description: Recently, the flourishing large language models(LLM), especially ChatGPT, have shown exceptional performance in language understanding, reasoning, and interaction, attracting users and researchers from multiple fields and domains.

item.title: BENO: Boundary-embedded Neural Operators for Elliptic PDEs
item.description: Here we introduce Boundary-Embedded Neural Operators (BENO), a novel neural operator architecture that embeds the complex geometries and inhomogeneous boundary values into the solving of elliptic PDEs.

item.title: Classification and Reconstruction Processes in Deep Predictive Coding Networks: Antagonists or Allies?
item.description: Predictive coding-inspired deep networks for visual computing integrate classification and reconstruction processes in shared intermediate layers.

item.title: CT Liver Segmentation via PVT-based Encoding and Refined Decoding
item.description: Accurate liver segmentation from CT scans is essential for computer-aided diagnosis and treatment planning.

item.title: Vlogger: Make Your Dream A Vlog
item.description: More importantly, Vlogger can generate over 5-minute vlogs from open-world descriptions, without loss of video coherence on script and actor.

item.title: Convex and Bilevel Optimization for Neuro-Symbolic Inference and Learning
item.description: We address a key challenge for neuro-symbolic (NeSy) systems by leveraging convex and bilevel optimization techniques to develop a general gradient-based framework for end-to-end neural and symbolic parameter learning.

item.title: MITS-GAN: Safeguarding Medical Imaging from Tampering with Generative Adversarial Networks
item.description: The progress in generative models, particularly Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), opened new possibilities for image generation but raised concerns about potential malicious uses, especially in sensitive areas like medical imaging.
